profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-12-14 10:42:40 -0500.

did.abstract: Letter from Moses M. Strong, of Mineral Point, Wisconsin, to C. M. Woodman of Dover, New Hampshire, regarding a book written by Strong and mentioning mutual acquaintances.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Moses M. Strong Letter must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Moses M. Strong Letter, Ms1988-015, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Moses M. Strong Letter was acquired by Special Collections prior to 1989.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing and description of the Moses M. Strong Letter commenced and was completed in November, 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Moses McClure Strong was born in Rutland, Vermont on May 20, 1810. After attending Middlebury and Dartmouth colleges, he studied law at Litchfield Law School and established a practice in Rutland. In 1836, Strong moved to Mineral Point, Wisconsin, and the following year, he was hired to survey Madison. In 1838, he was appointed the attorney and fiscal agent for Wisconsin Territory and represented Iowa County in the Wisconsin territorial legislative assembly from 1841 to 1846. In the latter year, he represented Iowa County in the first convention to draft a constitution for the proposed state of Wisconsin. Though this draft was ultimately rejected by the voters, Strong was elected to the new state's legislature in 1850. During his service in the legislature, Strong became an active promoter of the La Crosse and Milwaukee Railroad and was implicated in a bribery scandal that effectively ended his political career. During the 1870s, Strong wrote History of the Territory of Wisconsin from 1836 to 1848, published by the legislature in 1885.
Moses M. Strong died in Mineral Point, Wisconsin on July 20, 1894.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single letter written by Moses M. Strong, of Mineral Point, Wisconsin and addressed to C. W. Woodman of Dover, New Hampshire. The letter relates to Woodman's order of a copy of Strong's book (unnamed but almost certainly Strong's History of the Territory of Wisconsin from 1836 to 1848). Strong's letter also mentions mutual acquaintances at Dartmouth College.
